instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3024: What is 820-3024? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  no powering up
threads.message: I have problem here. Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no powering up. I have 8.4v on    <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>    not sure what to do next. any help?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  no powering up
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  no powering up
threads.message: yes i have 3.3v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> and green light on charger

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  no powering up
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> is coming high at least for a split of a second???? Water damage??? Any history about the reason of the fail???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  no powering up
threads.message: no water damaged.  guy in one of shops fitted screen with battery connected and short motherboard.  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>  is only 8.4v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  no powering up
threads.message: 8.4V is normal. Check all coils for shorts to GND.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  no powering up
threads.message: I have  short on  PPCPUVCCIO_S0_REG .  <RESISTOR>R7641</RESISTOR> pin 1 short. removed <CAPACITOR>C7623</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7648</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7649</CAPACITOR> still sort on pin 1 <RESISTOR>R7641</RESISTOR>. also i removed <RESISTOR>R7642</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7640</CAPACITOR>, <RESISTOR>R7641</RESISTOR> still short. any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  no powering up
threads.message: A low resistance is normal on this rail, what is the resistance to ground on L7630??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  no powering up
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  no powering up
threads.message: Uhm that means the board is powered up! Is a USB mouse lighting up when plugged in? Is there an image on the screen, check with flashlight.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  no powering up
threads.message: when i press power button usb mouse lights up so looks like is powered up but fan is no spinning even i changed for another one and screen is black. i used light behind screen and is not showing anything.it was job from another shop who was trying to change screen for new one. and this is new screen fitted. is that mean is different emc number screen fitted?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  no powering up
threads.message: Fan should spin. Is there voltage on L7510? Did you try with a known good LCD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  no powering up
threads.message:
L7510 : 0.001v
and there is 5.15v on pin 1 of fan connector J5600
this screen is brand new with stickers on it but i never try another screen . even that fan should spin when even screen is not connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  no powering up
threads.message: There is a voltage missing. I bet <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is low. If it is then it is up to you to find which voltage rail is missing.
